Generate_script_prompt:
Prompt: Give a quick tech news update script in the style of CNBC techcheck briefing as an example.
        Response: I'm Wall-E, and this is your CNBC techcheck Briefing for Monday April 29th. Tesla is asking shareholders to reinstate CEO Elon Musk's $56 billion pay package, which a Delaware judge voided earlier this year. The judge ruled that the record-setting compensation deal was, quote, deeply flawed. Tesla also saying it would ask shareholders to approve moving the company's incorporation from Delaware to Texas. The company has hired a proxy solicitor and plans to spend millions of dollars to help secure votes for the two proposals. Apple CEO Tim Cook says the company plans to look at manufacturing in Indonesia following a meeting with the country's president, Cook telling reporters following the meeting that he spoke with the president about his desire to see manufacturing there and that he believes in the country. The comments come as Apple is pushed to diversify its supply chain with more manufacturing outside of China in countries such as Vietnam and India. Shares of ASML falling today as the company missed its sales forecast but stuck to its full-year outlook. Net sales fell over 21 percent year-over-year, while net income dropped over 37 percent. ASML is highly important to the semiconductor industry as it builds machines that are required for manufacturing chips globally. Last year, weaker demand for consumer electronics hit chipmakers that produce for those devices, which has in turn impacted ASML. That's all for today. We'll see you back here tomorrow.
        Prompt: Give a quick tech news update script in the style of CNBC techcheck briefing using the following news titles and content. Use the same beginning and ending(including mentioning host Wall-E and Wednesday September 10), and replace CNBC techcheck briefing to 'AI briefing'

Response:
Script:
i'm wall-e, and this is your ai briefing for wednesday, september 10th.

first up, microsoft is making headlines again, this time with its proposed $69 billion acquisition of activision blizzard. the deal has faced scrutiny from regulators around the world, but microsoft is optimistic it will close by the end of the year. the acquisition is seen as a big move to bolster microsoft’s position in the gaming industry and enhance its gaming services with popular franchises like call of duty and world of warcraft.

in other news, amazon has unveiled a new line of eco-friendly packaging, aiming to reduce its carbon footprint. the company says its revamped packaging will eliminate plastics and use materials that are 100% recyclable. this effort is part of amazon’s broader push to become carbon neutral by 2040, aligning with its commitment to sustainability in response to increasing pressure from consumers and environmentalists.

meanwhile, in the world of social media, instagram rolls out a new “quiet mode” feature designed to help users take a break from the app. the feature allows users to set time limits and receive notifications encouraging them to step away when their designated period is up. this move comes as the platform faces criticism for its impact on mental health and aims to provide a more balanced user experience.

lastly, electric vehicle maker rivian shares are rising following reports of increased production capacity at their main factory. the company, which has seen a surge in demand for its electric trucks and suvs, is reportedly ramping up to meet this demand. rivian’s advancements are closely watched as they try to capture more market share from established giants like tesla.

that's all for today. we'll see you back here tomorrow
Polished Script:
i'm wall-e, welcoming you to today's tech briefing for wednesday, september 10th.

first, microsoft is in the spotlight with its proposed $69 billion acquisition of activision blizzard. despite facing global regulatory scrutiny, microsoft remains optimistic about closing the deal by year-end. this move is aimed at strengthening microsoft's position in the gaming industry, adding well-known franchises like call of duty and world of warcraft to its lineup.

in other news, amazon is pushing forward with sustainability by launching a new line of eco-friendly packaging. the company plans to eliminate plastics and use 100% recyclable materials as part of its broader commitment to become carbon neutral by 2040. this is amazon's response to growing consumer and environmentalist pressure.

switching gears to social media, instagram has introduced a “quiet mode” feature. this allows users to set time limits and receive notifications to take a break from the app, addressing concerns about social media's impact on mental health and enhancing the platform's user experience.

lastly, rivian shares are on the rise after reports of increased production capacity at their main factory. the electric vehicle maker is ramping up to meet soaring demand for its trucks and suvs. rivian's advancements are being closely watched as it competes with industry giants like tesla.

that's all for today. we'll see you back here tomorrow
Podcast Title: EP-363 Microsoft's $69b Gaming Power Play 🎮, Amazon's Eco-friendly Shift 🌿, Instagram's Mental Health Focus 🧘‍♂️
Podcast Description:
welcome to wall-e's tech briefing for wednesday, september 10th! today's top tech stories include:

  • microsoft & activision blizzard acquisition: microsoft proposes a $69 billion acquisition of activision blizzard, aiming to enhance its gaming industry status with popular franchises like call of duty and world of warcraft despite global regulatory challenges.
  • amazon's sustainability initiative: amazon introduces a new eco-friendly packaging line, focusing on 100% recyclable materials to support its goal of achieving carbon neutrality by 2040.
  • instagram's "quiet mode": the social media platform launches a feature allowing users to set app time limits to help mitigate social media's mental health impacts and improve user experience.
  • rivian's production boost: rivian's stock surges following increased production capacity reports to meet the growing demand for its electric trucks and suvs, intensifying competition with automakers like tesla.

tune in tomorrow for more tech updates!
